problems.title: Maximum Number of Occurrences of a Substring (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
Given a string s, return the maximum number of occurrences of any substring under the following rules:
1. The number of unique characters in the substring must be less than or equal to maxLetters.
2. The substring size must be between minSize and maxSize inclusive.

Input Format:
First line: string s.
Second line: three integers maxLetters, minSize, maxSize.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the maximum number of occurrences.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
aababcaab
2 3 4

Sample Output
2

Explanation: Substring "aab" has 2 occurrences.
problems.constraints:
1 <= s.length <= 10^5
1 <= maxLetters <= 26
1 <= minSize <= maxSize <= min(26, s.length)
hintsList: Focus on substrings of length minSize only, as they cover all valid occurrences.
Use a hash map to count occurrences of valid substrings.
